title: Red Hot Chili Peppers - [1988] The Abbey Road E.P.
description:
Red Hot Chili Peppers include: Anthony Kiedis (vocals); Hillel Slovak (guitar); Flea (bass); Jack Irons (drums).

Producers: Michael Beinhorn, George Clinton, Andy Gill.

Originally released on EMI America.

Just prior to guitarist Hillel Slovak&#039;s untimely death in 1988, the Red Hot Chili Peppers issued a five-track stop gap mini-album, THE ABBEY ROAD E.P. Four of the five tracks had already been included on past albums (1984&#039;s self-titled debut, 1985&#039;s FREAKY STYLEY, and 1987&#039;s UPLIFT MOFO PARTY PLAN), while an explosive cover of Jimi Hendrix&#039;s "Fire" was the only previously unreleased song, although it would turn up again on 1989&#039;s MOTHER&#039;S MILK. While it&#039;s likely that longtime Peppers fans will already be familiar with the tracks, newcomers will enjoy a brief overview of Flea and company&#039;s early years.
